ygData.subject: RE: Begging again
ygData.msgSnippet: Do you know what your Rangers friends skill is?  Where and what he begged to get the 7 plat?  I would really be interested in this information.  I have
ygData.messageBody:
Do you know what your Rangers friends skill is? Where and what he begged to
get the 7 plat? I would really be interested in this information. I have
recently hit skill 46 whoo hoo, and have results similar to John Kim's. I
was begging from the guards in Highkeep, ( near the zone ) :) Any
information would be really appreciated and helpfull to those of us
practicing the lost art :)

Thanks,
Sevin Tercet <Mischief>
23rd Level Human Bard
On Brell

-----Original Message-----
From: Dark [mailto:dark@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 14, 1999 5:13 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Begging again


From: "Dark" <dark@...>

Wow odd a ranger friend has gotten up to 7pp begging.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... <kim@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, October 14, 1999 8:40 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Begging again


>From: <kim@...>
>
>I hit 40 begging skill over the weekend and the difference is
>like night and day. Whereas with a skill of 39 I'd have to
>beg 5 or 10 times for each success (targeting amiable paladin
>guards in North Freeport), at 40 skill I'm succeeding more
>than half the time. The success rate still stinks with the
>dubious militia guards in West Freeport though.
>
>I still get 1 cp per successful beg. I've had one paladin
>give me 1 sp, but that's it. All my other successes have
>yielded only 1 cp. My guildmates are complaining that I'm
>giving the guild a bad reputation by begging around the bank
>so much. :-)
>
>I estimate I've successfully begged close to two hundred times
>(I dumped something like 35 practice points into the skill),
>and the paladins are still amiable to me. I once begged from
>one paladin nonstop for half an hour, and he never got upset
>or attacked me. The dubious milita has not attacked me
>either. I did beg from the dubious S. Ro dark elf merchants
>and they got upset and attacked me. Fortunately, it was a
>drive-by beg (target them from a distance, run by at full
>speed with Accelerando and a drum, and hit beg just as I pass)
>so they didn't even hit me.
>
>"How DARE you beg from me!" :-)
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>
>>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
with the subject lol.
>

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@... with
the subject lol.
